text:
In 2023, I won the Harvard
New Venture Competition

and moved to Indonesia to
continue building my startup.

Along the way, I found a much
bigger and more tangible problem

that affects the lives
of millions of families.

One in four children in
Southeast Asia is malnourished.

Yet, 60% don't even
know if their child
is deficient in key nutrients.

Current supplement
options are hard to give,

unappealing, or
filled with sugar.

That's why I pivoted
and founded Noolie.

Noolie makes tasty,
functional foods

using freeze-dried technology,
suitable for children
as young as six months old.

Our products are formulated with
researchers from the Harvard

School of Public
Health to tackle

specific health issues faced
by Southeast Asian children.

Within six months of launch,
we are already profitable,

with our products available in
major retailers across Singapore
and Indonesia.

Our revenue has grown 10 times,
with an organic repurchase

rate of 25% and a 70%
increase in average order
value on repeat purchases.

Earlier this year, we expanded
into Malaysia and Thailand.

And our revenue is expected
to hit $3.4 million this year.

Our team combines my
expertise in health foods

with my co-founder
Andrew's deep understanding
of Southeast Asian markets.

We are backed by
strategic investors,

including Flybridge
Capital, founded

by Professor Jeff Bussgang,
and Insignia Capital Partners.

Join us as we
revolutionize nutrition
for children and the family.
